member.name: T:uZone.RequestError
member.summary: A list of all error codes they can be returned by the class.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.Unknown
member.summary: Unknow error. The underlying code does not have enough information to qualify the error.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.NoError
member.summary: No error - the request operation was successfull

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.BadRequest
member.summary: Request was rejected by the uZone system. Either Master or Node was unable to process the request at the moment.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.MasterError
member.summary: Failed due to an internal error on uZone Master.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.InstanceTimeout
member.summary: The instance failed to start within defined time interval.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.ClientError
member.summary: Failed due to an unexpected client exception.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.NodeOffline
member.summary: Can't process a node related request. The node is currently not available.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.TypeNotAvailable
member.summary: A requested instance type is not supported by any of nodes (according to other rules)

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.InvalidAffinity
member.summary: Afinity parameter was invalid. Cannot launch an instance at a given CPU or core.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.BadPath
member.summary: Failed because the instance (at a given node) is registered under a bad/no path.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.ExecutableNotFound
member.summary: Request failed as the node could not find the instance executable at its registered path.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.ExecutableError
member.summary: Request failed due to an error that occurred while opening the instance executable.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.UnknownStartupError
member.summary: Request failed due to an unknown error that occurred during instance startup.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.NoPortAvailable
member.summary: Request failed as the node failed to allocate a port for the instance to use.

member.name: F:uZone.RequestError.InstanceUnavailable
member.summary: The instance referenced in the request does not exist. Presumably it was shutdown before the request could reach the uZone Master server.

member.name: T:uZone.NodeSelectionMode
member.summary: The modes in this enumeration provide a smart and powerfull way how to start a new instance by letting uZone to choose the right node for you.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.Default
member.summary: A default behaviour, currently mapped to RoundRobin

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.RunningLeastInstances
member.summary: A new instance will be launched on a node currently running the smallest number of instances.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.RunningMostInstances
member.summary: A new instance will be launched on a node currently running the highest number of instances Not yet implemented. Currently mapped to default.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.RoundRobin
member.summary: These scenario causes the nodes to "cycle". You may find it useful if you want to balance number of running instances on nodes which were started at the same moment. On the other hand, this mode is not suitable for situations where some node(s) are already running couple of instances and there are other completely fresh node(s) at the same time.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.LeastCPULoad
member.summary: A new instance will be launched on a node which is currently experiencing the least (relative) CPU load Not yet implemented. Currently mapped to default.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.MostRAMAvailable
member.summary: A new instance will be launched on a node which is currently having the most (absolute) RAM available Not yet implemented. Currently mapped to default.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeSelectionMode.LeastBandwidthLoad
member.summary: A new instance will be launched on a node which is currently experiencing least (absolute) network load. Not yet implemented. Currently mapped to default.

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceState
member.summary: Used to represent the current instance status in .
member.remarks: Some of the states should be considered as internal and the user code should ignore them.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Starting
member.summary: Internal. Will be removed later. We will never expose an instance to an user API before it reach the running state.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Running
member.summary: The instance is currently running. There is no problem about it. :-)

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Unresponsive
member.summary: The instance is currently non-responding but there is a chance that it will get better again. This state should be understood as temporary/transition

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Stopping
member.summary: The instance is currently stopping. This state should be understood as temporary/transition. The next state (under normal conditions) should be but could be different if something unexpected will happen.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Stopped
member.summary: The instance stopped peacefully.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Crashed
member.summary: Abnormal instance termination occurred. The instance crashed.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.NonExisting
member.summary: Internal. Will be removed later.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceState.Unreachable
member.summary: This status is set when the owning node is disconnected/unreachable.

member.name: T:uZone.NodeState
member.summary: Used to represent the current node status in .

member.name: F:uZone.NodeState.Available
member.summary: Several conditions neeeds to be met to declare the Node as available: - The Node is running and connected to the uZone Master server - The Client is succefully connected to the uZone Master server

member.name: F:uZone.NodeState.Unavailable
member.summary: One (or more) of the conditions mentioned in the Available state description is not met.

member.name: F:uZone.NodeState.Discarded
member.summary: The node gets into the discarded state when it got disconnected from the uZone Master server and was unable to connect successfuly back in a reasonable time. Only Master can set the node into this state. This state is final.

member.name: T:uZone.ConnectionError
member.summary: This error code is reported via OnFailedToConnect callback when fails to connect to the uZone Master server.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.CreateSocketOrThreadFailure
member.summary: A problem occured on a local computer. It is unable to create the socket or a related resource.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.AlreadyConnecting
member.summary: Another connect request is already running.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.AlreadyConnected
member.summary: There is already a connection established.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.NoError
member.summary: Success

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.Disconnecting
member.summary: The connection was cancelled due to a Disconnect call.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.ConnectionFailed
member.summary: In general, any other problem than "host unreachable"

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.IncompatibleVersions
member.summary: The client and the server are running incompatible versions.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Unable to connect to the server within given timeout interval. It is kind of "host unrechable" error.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectionError.HandshakeFailed
member.summary: The host was reached but communication failed.

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceOptions
member.summary: Contains startup options and configurations regarding instances.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceOptions.arguments
member.summary: A list of arguments that are sent as command-line input to the instance. Can for example contain Unity3D flags such as '-batchmode', but also custom arguments.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceOptions.commandLine
member.summary: The command line arguments passed to the launched instance.
member.remarks:
In fact, this string represents only a part of the command-line arguments. The seconds part comes from the related instance type definition. Thus, the commandLine member here respresents the dynamic part of the instance process's command-line while the instance type definition represents the static part of it.
Pay an extra attention to the command line format because it use to be a source of tricky and difficult (time consuming) to find problems. Use spaces to distinguish individual arguments. If you want to pass several words (a text string containing spaces) as a single argument just enclose such character sequence in quotation marks.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceOptions.processorAffinity
member.summary: Sets the processors on which the associated instance can run. Each processor it can run on has its bit set to 1. As an example, assigning this property the value of 1 would allow the instance to run on the first processor, 2 on the second processor, and 3 on both the first and second processor (determined by the OS). Default behavior is to allow all available processors to run the instance.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceOptions.instanceType
member.summary: Sets what type of instance should be started. This name is associated with a binary path on nodes where it is installed.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.
Processor affinity.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.
Arguments.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.
Processor affinity.
Arguments.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.
Command-line arguments

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Instance type.
Processor affinity.
Command-line arguments.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceOptions.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceOptions.gameType
member.summary: Sets what type of instance should be started. This name is associated with a binary path on nodes where it is installed.

member.name: T:uZone.LogLevel
member.summary: The available log levels that can be set for minimum logging and also can be set per log category.

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Off
member.summary: Logs nothing.

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Logs errors only

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Logs warnings and errors.

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: Logs info messages, warnings and errors.

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Logs debug messages, info messages, warnings and errors. The most detailed log level available.

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Informational
member.summary: Deprecated, please use NetworkLogLevel.Info instead

member.name: F:uZone.LogLevel.Full
member.summary: Deprecated, please use NetworkLogLevel.Debug instead

member.name: T:uZone.LogFlags
member.summary: The different log categories currently available. Each item is a binary flag. You can create various combinations by "or"-ing individual flags together. These flags can be used to define verbosity of the log output which can be set by the method.

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.None
member.summary: no cathegory = no output at all

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.Node
member.summary: A node related log records

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.RPC
member.summary: Internal data, messages and RPCs communication log records

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.Network
member.summary: Involves all the log records related to the low level network communication, like connection/disconnection process, handshakes, connection timeouts etc.

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.BadMessage
member.summary: Involves bad data formats, invalid parameters, non-existing object ids or RPC names etc.

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.Master
member.summary: Master related log records

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.Performance
member.summary: Performance related log records

member.name: F:uZone.LogFlags.All
member.summary: A predefined value representing all the LogFlagss

member.name: T:uZone.Log
member.summary: Class for configuring uZone logging.

member.name: F:uZone.Log.errorWriter
member.summary: The delegate writing error messages. Default implementation send output to the Editor console / output_log.txt file.

member.name: F:uZone.Log.warningWriter
member.summary: The delegate writing warning messages. Default implementation send output to the Editor console / output_log.txt file.

member.name: F:uZone.Log.infoWriter
member.summary: The delegate writing info messages. Default implementation send output to the Editor console / output_log.txt file.

member.name: F:uZone.Log.debugWriter
member.summary: The delegate writing debug messages. Default implementation send output to the Editor console / output_log.txt file.

member.name: F:uZone.Log.minLevel
member.summary: The minimum level for all logging categories. This can be overruled by setting a detailed log level for an individual category to a higher log level via .

member.name: M:uZone.Log.HasLevel(uZone.LogFlags,uZone.LogLevel)
member.summary: Returns true if the the categories (flags) are set by either or .

member.name: M:uZone.Log.SetLevel(uZone.LogFlags,uZone.LogLevel)
member.summary: Sets a detailed logging level for the specified categories (flags). If the categories (flags) is set to a lower log level than then overrules the detailed log level when logging.

member.name: M:uZone.Log.GetMaxLevel(uZone.LogFlags)
member.summary: Gets the highest detailed log level configured for any of the log categories (flags), where is the lowest and is the highest.

member.name: M:uZone.Log.GetMinLevel(uZone.LogFlags)
member.summary: Gets the lowest detailed log level configured for any of the log categories (flags), where is the lowest and is the highest.

member.name: M:uZone.Log.SetNetworkingLogLevel(uZone.LogLevel)
member.summary: Sets the logging level of internal networking library.

member.name: P:uZone.Log.errorFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the log categories for the .

member.name: P:uZone.Log.warningFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the log categories for the .

member.name: P:uZone.Log.infoFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the log categories for the .

member.name: P:uZone.Log.debugFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the log categories for the .

member.name: T:uZone.Log.Writer
member.summary: Implement one or several new delegates if there is a need to replace the default Writers in this class.

member.name: T:uZone.Exceptions.InstanceManagerUnknownException
member.summary: This exception is reserved for a very special cases when we can't really identify/name the problem. Normally it should not appear.

member.name: T:uZone.Exceptions.InstanceManagerException
member.summary: A base class for all InstanceManager realated exceptions

member.name: P:uZone.Exceptions.InstanceManagerException.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that describes the current exception.

member.name: P:uZone.Exceptions.InstanceManagerException.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the immediate frames on the call stack.

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceManager
member.summary: This is one of the most important classes in uZone. It is the main class of the client side of the system.
member.remarks:
This class allows the client to connect to a uZone Master server, list to existing nodes and instances, request to start a new Instance, register to various events and much more.
The first thing you have to do is to initialize it by calling the
method.
Consequently you have to connect to a uZone Master server. That can be done by calling the
method. Once you are successfully connected you can use all the remaining parts of the API. Conversely, if you are not connected, many methods will throw the
exception once they are called.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.Initialize(uZone.InstanceManager.GlobalEvents)
member.summary: Initializes the instance manager, which allows the application to start and stop instances through uZone's interface.
member.param: Can be used to register all the requested global event listeners at once. Each member of the structure may be set to null.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the instance manager, which allows the application to start and stop instances through uZone's interface.
member.remarks:
There is another overloaded
function overload which allows you to initialize uZone client (InstanceManager) and define a set of global event listeners at the same time.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.Connect(System.String,System.Int32,uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.ConnectRequest},uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.ConnectRequest})
member.summary: Connects the instance manager to a uZone Master server at a given endpoint.
member.param: The IP/Hostname of the uZone Master server.
The port number where the uZone Master server is listening on.
A callback routine which is triggered once the connect request finished sucessfully. Can be set to null.
A callback routine which is triggered once the connect request failed. Can be set to null.
member.returns: Returns the request object even when the function fails.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects the instance manager to a uZone Master server at a given endpoint.
member.param: The IP/Hostname of the uZone Master server.
The port number where the uZone Master server is listening on.
member.returns: Returns the request object even when the function fails.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the instance manager. This will also remove all pending and queued requests.

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceManager.StartInstance(uZone.InstanceOptions,uZone.NodeSelectionMode,uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StartInstanceRequest},uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StartInstanceRequest})
member.summary: Creates and sends a request to uZone to start a new instance. The state of the request is available in the returned object.
member.param: Contains options and parameters for the new instance.
Selects what algorithm should be used to chose what node to start the instance on.
An optional callback
Callback that is executed on error.
member.returns: Information regarding the request and its state

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceManager.id
member.summary: An unique client identifier. It is generated/assigned by uZone Master.

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceManager.isConnected
member.summary: Returns whether the InstanceManager is fully connected to a uZone Master server.

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onDisconnected
member.summary: Used to notify the application when the client disconnects from a uZone Master server.

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onNodeConnected
member.summary: Used to notify application about a new new node connected

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onNodeDisconnected
member.summary: Used to notify application about an existing node disconnected

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onNodeStateChanged
member.summary: Used to notify application when the state of the node changed

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onInstanceStarted
member.summary: Used to notify application about a new instance started

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onInstanceStopped
member.summary: Used to notify application about an existing instance stopeed

member.name: E:uZone.InstanceManager.onInstanceStateChanged
member.summary: Used to notify application when the state of the instance changed

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceManager.nodes
member.summary: Returns all currently known nodes

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceManager.GlobalEvents
member.summary: This structure helps to register all the global event listeners at the same time and right during the initiation of uZone client (InstanceManager)
member.remarks: The "global events" does mean that the related events are triggered as they appear in the uZone system without any filtering. There are also local (object oriented versions) for all Node and InstanceProcess related events. Check all the public events declared at and classes

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceManager.GlobalEvents.onDisconnected
member.summary: Global delegate.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceManager.GlobalEvents.onNodeConnected
member.summary: Global delegate.

member.summary: Global delegate.

member.summary: Global delegate.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceManager.GlobalEvents.onInstanceStateChanged
member.summary: Global delegate.

member.summary: Used to notify the application when the client disconnects from a uZone Master server.

member.summary: Used to notify the application about a new new node connected

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceManager.Debug
member.summary: This class is here for debug and statistics purposes only.
member.remarks: The content of this class may change without any prior warnings, backward compatibility is not guaranteed. Normaly there should be no reason to use it unless you are trying to identify some problem.

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceManager.Debug.pendingRequests
member.summary: Returns the count of currently pending requests.

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceManager.Debug.queuedRequests
member.summary: Returns the count of currently queued requests.

member.name: T:uZone.Request
member.summary: Base class for all the request classes.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.WaitUntilDone
member.summary: Use this function to wait for the request to complete, i.e. until Request.isDone is true, using the Unity coroutine mechanism. Typically you would call 'yield return request.WaitUntilDone();' from a coroutine before examining the result of the request. The coroutine will resume once any given success or error callback has finished, unless the request was cancelled by the user. Then the coroutine will resume without any callback being invoked.
member.returns: A Coroutine object that can be yielded on from a coroutine.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.GetError
member.summary: Gets the error status of a failed request.
member.returns: The error status of the request.
member.remarks: If there is no error, this will throw a InstanceManagerException. If you are unsure if the request has an error or not, you can avoid the exception by checking Request.hasFailed or by using Request.TryGetError().

member.name: M:uZone.Request.TryGetError(uZone.RequestError@)
member.summary: Gets the error status of the request. The error will be returned through the requestError out parameter.
member.param: The resulting error status of the request.
member.returns: True if the request has failed, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.GetErrorString
member.summary: Gets the error message of a failed request.
member.returns: The error message of the request.
member.remarks: If there is no error, this will throw a InstanceManagerException. If you are unsure if the request has an error or not, you can avoid the exception by checking Request.hasFailed or by using Request.TryGetErrorString().

member.name: M:uZone.Request.TryGetErrorString(System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the error message of the request. The error will be returned through the error out parameter.
member.param: The resulting error message of the request.
member.returns: True if the request has failed, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.ToStringState
member.summary: This is a ToString helper function which should be used to child classes to help them to integrate the request state into their ToString resultant strings.
member.returns: The request state in the text format.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.name: M:uZone.Request.InvokeResponseCallback
member.summary: Invokes the response callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.
member.returns: true, if response callback was invoked, false otherwise.

member.name: M:uZone.Request.InvokeErrorCallback
member.summary: Invokes the error callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.
member.returns: true, if error callback was invoked, false otherwise.

member.name: P:uZone.Request.isDone
member.summary: Indicates whether the request has returned, either from success or failure.

member.name: P:uZone.Request.isSuccessful
member.summary: Indicates whether the request has been successfully completed.

member.name: P:uZone.Request.isCancelled
member.summary: Indicates whether the request has been cancelled by the user.

member.name: P:uZone.Request.hasFailed
member.summary: Indicates whether the request has failed.

member.name: T:uZone.OnResponseCallback`1
member.summary: Used by the different request classes to describe a callback that is invoked when the request completes. It is used for both successful and failed requests.
member.typeparam: The type of the request object.
member.param: The request from which the callback was invoked.

member.name: T:uZone.StartInstanceRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to start an instance through uZone.

member.name: F:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.options
member.summary: The instance options applied to the instance.

member.name: F:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.node
member.summary: This is an input parameter. It points to a node the new instance should be launched on or it may be set to null when it is uZone Master responsibility to assign the request to a node.
member.remarks:
This parameter is indirectly defined by an application programmer based on the request creation method. If the request is created by the
method the node member is set to the reference to the given node. If the request is created by the
it is set to null.

member.name: F:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.selectionMode
member.summary: The algorithm used by uZone to decide what node should start the instance, given that no node was given explicitly. if PeerID was supplied,

member.name: M:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.GetInstance
member.summary: Gets the newly started instance, given that it started successfully.
member.returns: Newly started instance process.
member.remarks: If the request failed or is still active, this will throw a InstanceManagerException. If you are unsure if the request has succeeded or not, you can avoid the exception by checking or by using .

member.name: M:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.TryGetInstance(uZone.InstanceProcess@)
member.summary: Safe version of
member.returns: Returns true when the request was sucessfull and the requested value is available and valid, otherwise returns false.
member.param: Contains the newly started instance process when the function returns true.

member.name: M:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.InvokeErrorCallback
member.summary: Invokes the error callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.

member.name: M:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.InvokeResponseCallback
member.summary: Invokes the response callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.

member.name: M:uZone.StartInstanceRequest.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.summary: Represents a request to shut down one or several instances through uZone.

member.name: F:uZone.StopInstanceRequest.instance
member.summary: The instance requested to stop

member.name: M:uZone.StopInstanceRequest.InvokeErrorCallback
member.summary: Invokes the error callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.

member.name: M:uZone.StopInstanceRequest.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: T:uZone.Instance
member.summary: This is the main class for the Instance side of the uZone system. This class is responsible for the module initialization/connection and tracking the instance connection status.

member.name: M:uZone.Instance.Initialize(uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents)
member.summary: Initialize this instance.
member.remarks: Each instance-side application (mostly a game server) must call this function at the moment when the application is fully initialized and ready to use. The application fails to start properly from the uZone node point of view when this function call is omitted.
member.param: Set of all global events supported by the instance side.

member.name: M:uZone.Instance.Initialize(System.Int32,uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents)
member.summary: Initializes uZone on an instance started by the uZone instance manager by connecting it to the uZone system. This will put the instance in the 'Running'-state. Use this overload when port allocation is turned off, or when the instance uses another port than the one allocated by uZone.
member.param: This is the port the instance uses (listens on) for communication with the parent uZone node.
Set of all global events supported by the instance side.

member.name: P:uZone.Instance.peerID
member.summary: The peerID contains identifier within the uZone network. Returns the PeerID.unassigned value once disconnected.

member.name: P:uZone.Instance.port
member.summary: The port used by the instance (game server) to accept incoming client connections. Initially assigned by uZone if port allocation is turned on in the system, or else defaults to -1. If the instance fails to use the port or if port allocation is turned off, assign the actual port used when calling . This will override the allocated port (which will be made available for use by future instances), and update the corresponding value in uZone.

member.name: P:uZone.Instance.isConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is connected.
member.value: true if is connected; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:uZone.Instance.wasStartedByuZone
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this Unity instance was started through uZone.
member.remarks: If false, any calls to will fail.

member.name: T:uZone.Instance.OnInitializedHandler
member.summary: Used to notify the application when the instance connects to the parent uZone node. The instance is considered as fully initialized (from the uZone point of view) once this event is triggered.

member.name: T:uZone.Instance.OnFailedToInitializeHandler
member.summary: Used to notify that the instance failed to connect to a parent node.
member.remarks:
That usualy happens when the application is not launched via uZone system but directly.
The triggering of this event does mean that the instance application is not a part of the uZone network and thus failed to initialize. In such case you should consider to terminate your instance application or to switch it into an "unmanaged" mode.

member.name: T:uZone.Instance.OnNodeLostHandler
member.summary: Used to notify the application when the connection between the parent node and thi instance application is lost.
member.remarks:
The triggering of this event does mean that the parent node either crashed or is non-responsive.
In such case you should consider to terminate your instance application or to switch it into an "unmanaged" mode.

member.name: T:uZone.Instance.OnStoppingSignalHandler
member.summary: This event is triggered when the is delivered through the uZone network to the target instance application.
member.remarks: This is not an notification event but a signal. The application is responsible to terminate gracefully within a reasonable time (before the timeout is reached). Once the timeout is reached the instance process is forcibly killed by the parent node. Check the node config file documentation for more details.

member.name: T:uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents
member.summary: This structure helps to register all the global event listeners at the same time and right during the initiation of uZone Instance application

member.name: F:uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents.onInitialized
member.summary: Global delegate.

member.name: F:uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents.onFailedToInitialize
member.summary: Global delegate.
member.remarks: If no handler is provided by the application (null is passed) a default handler is used. The default handler simply calls the standard System.Application.Quit() method.

member.name: F:uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents.onNodeLost
member.summary: Global delegate.
member.remarks: If no handler is provided by the application (null is passed) a default handler is used. The default handler simply calls the standard System.Application.Quit() method.

member.name: F:uZone.Instance.GlobalEvents.onStoppingSignal
member.summary: Global delegate.
member.remarks: If no handler is provided by the application (null is passed) a default handler is used. The default handler simply calls the standard System.Application.Quit() method.

member.name: T:uZone.Node
member.summary: This class represents a specific uZone node on the client (InstanceManager) side.

member.name: F:uZone.Node.id
member.summary: Uniques identifier of the node. It is generated/assigned by uZone Master.

member.name: F:uZone.Node.publicAddress
member.summary: The hostname/address on which the node and its instances is publicly reachable.

member.name: M:uZone.Node.StartInstance(uZone.InstanceOptions,uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StartInstanceRequest},uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StartInstanceRequest})
member.summary: Creates a new asynchronous request which shoud start a new instance directly on this node.
member.param: Contains options and parameters for the new instance.
An optional callback
Callback that is executed on error.
member.returns: Information regarding the request and its state

member.name: M:uZone.Node.StartInstance(uZone.InstanceOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new asynchronous request which shoud start a new instance directly on this node.
member.param: Contains options and parameters for the new instance.
member.returns: Information regarding the request and its state

member.name: M:uZone.Node.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.name: E:uZone.Node.onInstanceStarted
member.summary: Used to notify application about a new instance started

member.name: E:uZone.Node.onInstanceStopped
member.summary: Used to notify application about an existing instance stopeed

member.name: E:uZone.Node.onStateChanged
member.summary: Used to notify application when the state of the node changed

member.name: P:uZone.Node.customAttributes
member.summary: A dictionary like collection of custom attributes. They consists of key-value string pairs.

member.name: P:uZone.Node.instanceTypes
member.summary: A plain list of all instance types supported by given node.

member.name: P:uZone.Node.state
member.summary: Current state of the given node.

member.name: P:uZone.Node.instances
member.summary: Returns all currently known (and ready to use) instances related to the given node

member.name: T:uZone.Node.OnInstanceStartedHandler
member.summary: Used to notify application about a new instance started

member.summary: Used to notify application about an existing instance stopeed

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceProcess
member.summary: This class represents a specific uZone instance process on the client (InstanceManager) side.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.node
member.summary: Points to a node the instance is running on. This member is allways valid (non-null)

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.id
member.summary: Unique identifier of the instance process.
member.remarks: This is an internal uZone identifier, not the well known !

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.type
member.summary: Instance type.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.pid
member.summary: Classic process identifier

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.port
member.summary: The port used by the instance to accept incoming player connections.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.commandLine
member.summary: Command-line arguments as they were provided by the client when it was requesting to start the instance.
member.remarks:
This variable contains only a part of the command-line arguments. Another part is taken from the given instance type definition of the related node configuration file. See and for more info.
This member contains only a subset of the member variable.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceProcess.fullCommandLine
member.summary: This member contains the exact content of the command-line as it was passed to the instance process (at the creation time).

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceProcess.Stop(uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StopInstanceRequest},uZone.OnResponseCallback{uZone.StopInstanceRequest})
member.summary: Requests to stop a running instance. It creates and activates the StopInstanceRequest.
member.returns: Returns reference to a StopInstanceRequest. It might return null when either the instance itself or owning node is not ready to process such request (disconnected, connection is lost, instance is already stopped)

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceProcess.Stop
member.summary: Requests to stop a running instance. It creates and activates the StopInstanceRequest.
member.returns: Returns reference to a StopInstanceRequest. It might return null when either the instance itself or owning node is not ready to process such request (disconnected, connection is lost, instance is already stopped)

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceProcess.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.summary: Used to notify application when the state of the instance changed

member.name: P:uZone.InstanceProcess.state
member.summary: Gets or sets the state.

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceProcess.OnStateChangedHandler
member.summary: Used to notify application when the state of the instance changed

member.name: T:uZone.ConnectRequest
member.summary: This class represents an asynchronous connection request.

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectRequest.host
member.summary: The host information passed from the application code

member.name: F:uZone.ConnectRequest.port
member.summary: The port information passed from the application code

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.GetAssignedID
member.summary: Returns the assigned peer id when the request succeeded.
member.returns: Peer id assigned by the underlying network layer.
member.remarks: If the request failed or is still active, this will throw a InstanceManagerException. If you are unsure if the request has succeeded or not, you can avoid the exception by checking or by using .

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.TryGetAssignedID(uZone.ClientID@)
member.summary: Safe version of
member.returns: Returns true when the request was sucessfull and the requested value is available and valid, otherwise returns false.
member.param: Contains assigned ID when the function returns true.

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.GetConnectionError
member.summary: Returns the specific connection error when the request failed.
member.remarks: This method throws the InstanceManagerException exception when the request has not failed. If you are unsure if the request has failed or not, you can avoid the exception by checking or by using .

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.TryGetConnectionError(uZone.ConnectionError@)
member.summary: Safe version of
member.returns: Returns true when the requested value is available and valid, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .
member.returns: A that represents the current .

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.InvokeErrorCallback
member.summary: Invokes the error callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.

member.name: M:uZone.ConnectRequest.InvokeResponseCallback
member.summary: Invokes the response callback. Kind of interface method. Each derived class must to implement it.

member.name: T:uZone.InstanceID
member.summary: This class represents an identifier
member.remarks:
This class was designed for a logging/debuging purposes only. Objects of this class are never used as an input argument by uZone client API. That's why there is no public ctor available.
Alternatively, it can be used to store and compare identifiers on the client side.

member.name: F:uZone.InstanceID.unassigned
member.summary: A special pre-defined value. Usually used for uninitialized/non-connected network connections.

member.summary: equality comparison operator

member.summary: is greater or equal comparison operator

member.summary: is lower or equal comparison operator

member.summary: is greater comparison operator

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceID.op_LessThan(uZone.InstanceID,uZone.InstanceID)
member.summary: is lower comparison operator

member.name: M:uZone.InstanceID.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a object.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance that is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
